tidbits.title: Okavango Delta
tidbits.description: Botswana is home to the Okavango Delta, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the world's largest inland deltas, teeming with diverse wildlife and pristine landscapes.

tidbits.title: Conservation Success
tidbits.description: Botswana is a leader in conservation efforts, with initiatives like the ban on elephant hunting and successful preservation of wildlife habitats in parks like Chobe and Moremi.

tidbits.title: Cultural Heritage
tidbits.description: Botswana's rich cultural heritage is reflected in its traditional music, dance, and crafts, with communities like the San preserving ancient ways of life.
